title: Massimiliano Allegri wants to make two changes at Man Utd if he replaces Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
text:
Massimiliano Allegri is making plans in the event he becomes Manchester United manager (Getty Images)

Massimiliano Allegri wants Patrice Erva on his coaching staff at Manchester United if he replaces Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as manager, according to reports.

Solskjaer is already under huge pressure following his side’s slow start to the season, while United look like they could struggle to secure a top-four finish in the Premier League.

Allegri is reportedly on United’s shortlist of candidates if the club decide to call time on Solskjaer’s reign at Old Trafford.

And according to MailOnline, Allegri is already planning his backroom set-up in preparation of taking the job at United.

Patrice Evra played under Allegri at Juventus (Getty Images)

The report claims that Allegri has ‘promised’ Evra a place as a first-team coach if he becomes United’s next manager.

Last month, Evra returned to United as a youth coach while he continues to work on his UEFA coaching badges.

Allegri also wants to bring Marco Landucci to United (Getty Images)

Evra, who retired in July, already has experience of working under Allegri having played under the Italian at Juventus.

The report also claims that Allegri would want to bring Marco Landucci, his assistant at Juve, with him to United along with Evra.

Allegri is currently out of work having left Juventus at the end of last season.
